wiki_catalogs.name: Project Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Vertex Education website project overview. Explain the purpose of this educational consultancy platform, its target audience (students seeking higher education opportunities), and core value proposition. Document the project's mission to provide admission counseling, placement support, study abroad opportunities, financial aid, and campus experience services. Include the technology stack overview, key features like interactive navigation, custom cursor effects, and location-based college directories. Provide context about the educational consulting industry and how this digital platform addresses student needs. Use terminology consistent with the educational consultancy domain and make content accessible to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

wiki_catalogs.name: Navigation System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the navigation system components. Document the Navbar component implementation including scroll effects, mobile menu functionality, and smooth scrolling navigation. Explain the state management for scrolled state and mobile menu visibility. Detail the integration with React Router for both in-app navigation and cross-page navigation. Document the scroll-into-view functionality for anchor links and the mobile-responsive hamburger menu design. Include implementation details for event handlers, useEffect cleanup, and the navigation click handler logic. Provide examples of navigation configuration, styling customization, and responsive behavior patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Hero Section
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the Hero section component. Explain the animated hero layout with staggered fade-in effects using React state and useEffect hooks. Document the background shape elements and their positioning. Detail the call-to-action button implementation with hover scaling effects. Cover the responsive design patterns and CSS transition delays. Include implementation of the loaded state mechanism for animation triggering. Provide examples of content customization and styling modifications. Address accessibility considerations for the hero content and navigation integration.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive getting started documentation for the Vertex Education website development environment. Include detailed prerequisites (Node.js version requirements), step-by-step installation instructions using npm, development server startup commands, and build process explanations. Document the Vite build configuration, hot module replacement setup, and development workflow. Provide clear instructions for running the application locally, accessing the development server, and understanding the project structure. Include troubleshooting common setup issues and verification steps to ensure proper installation. Make the content beginner-friendly while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Interactive Elements
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for interactive elements, focusing on the custom cursor implementation. Document the CustomCursor component's dual-cursor system with main cursor and follower trail effects. Explain the Anime.js integration for smooth animations and hover state management. Detail the mouse event handling, position tracking, and animation timing configurations. Document the cursor scaling effects on interactive elements and the overall user experience enhancements. Include implementation details for cursor customization, performance considerations, and browser compatibility. Provide examples of cursor effect customization and integration patterns with other interactive elements.

wiki_catalogs.name: About Section
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the About section component. Detail the mission presentation layout and statistics display implementation. Explain the grid-based content organization and responsive design patterns. Document the styling approach using CSS variables and custom properties. Cover the component's role in establishing brand credibility and trust. Include examples of content modification and statistics customization. Address the visual hierarchy and typography choices used to communicate the company's values and achievements.

wiki_catalogs.name: Application Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Vertex Education React application. Describe the component-based architecture pattern, React Router integration for client-side navigation, and the hierarchical component structure. Document the main App component as the root container, its relationship with child components (Navbar, Hero, About, Services, etc.), and the overall application flow. Explain the routing strategy, state management patterns using React hooks, and component composition principles. Include system boundaries, data flow between components, and integration patterns. Address the single-page application architecture, performance considerations, and scalability aspects. Provide architectural diagrams showing component relationships and data flow patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Content Sections
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the main content sections of the educational consultancy website. Document the Hero section with dynamic call-to-action elements and engagement strategies. Detail the About section's mission presentation and statistics display. Explain the Services section's five-point service grid with icon integration and descriptions. Document the Courses section's educational program showcase and category organization. Cover the Partners section's institutional partnership display with marquee animation. For each section, explain the component structure, responsive design implementation, animation effects, and content management patterns. Include styling approaches, accessibility considerations, and content customization options.

wiki_catalogs.name: Services Section
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the Services section component. Explain the five-point service grid implementation with React component structure. Document the icon integration using React Icons and service description formatting. Detail the responsive grid layout and mobile adaptation strategies. Cover the service data structure and content management patterns. Include examples of adding new services and customizing service cards. Address the visual design elements including spacing, typography, and interactive hover states.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Documentation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive component documentation for the Vertex Education website's React component library. Document each major component including Navbar, CustomCursor, Hero, About, Services, Courses, Partners, Colleges, CollegeListPage, Contact, and Footer. For each component, explain its purpose, props interface, internal state management, event handlers, and integration with other components. Include implementation details, styling approaches, responsive design considerations, and accessibility features. Document component lifecycle methods, performance optimizations, and reusability patterns. Provide usage examples, code snippets, and integration guidelines. Address component composition patterns, prop drilling scenarios, and state management strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: College Exploration System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the college exploration system components. Document the Colleges component's location-based college gateway with state-specific navigation. Explain the CollegeListPage component's dynamic college listing functionality based on route parameters. Detail the integration between the gateway and list pages for seamless user experience. Document the state selection logic, route parameter handling, and dynamic content loading mechanisms. Include implementation details for college data management, filtering capabilities, and responsive layout patterns. Provide examples of adding new locations, customizing college displays, and integrating external college data sources.

wiki_catalogs.name: Courses Section
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the Courses section component. Detail the educational program showcase implementation and course category organization. Explain the tag-based filtering system and content categorization approach. Document the responsive layout for displaying course offerings across different screen sizes. Cover the component's role in presenting academic programs and specializations. Include examples of adding new course categories and modifying course displays. Address the styling patterns used for course cards and category navigation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Styling and Theming
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive styling documentation for the Vertex Education website's CSS architecture. Document the CSS-in-JS approach, CSS variable usage for theming, responsive design patterns, and animation implementations. Explain the styling methodology, class naming conventions, and component-specific styling approaches. Include documentation of the custom cursor animations, hover effects, transition effects, and responsive breakpoints. Document the color scheme, typography system, spacing conventions, and utility classes. Provide guidelines for adding new styles, modifying existing themes, and maintaining consistency across components. Address browser compatibility, performance optimization for CSS delivery, and accessibility considerations in the styling approach.

wiki_catalogs.name: Contact Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the contact management system. Document the Contact component's information display functionality and contact form implementation. Explain the multi-state office location presentation and contact information organization. Detail the form handling, validation, and submission processes. Document the responsive design for contact forms and information layouts. Include implementation details for contact data management, form state handling, and integration with external contact systems. Provide examples of customizing contact information, adding new office locations, and implementing additional contact features.

wiki_catalogs.name: Partners Section
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the Partners section component. Explain the institutional partnership display implementation with marquee animation effects. Document the animation library integration using Anime.js for continuous scrolling. Detail the partner logo presentation and responsive design considerations. Cover the animation timing, direction control, and performance optimization. Include examples of adding new partners and customizing animation parameters. Address the visual impact of the marquee effect and its role in establishing credibility through institutional associations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Assets and Media Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for asset and media management in the Vertex Education website. Document the organization of static assets in the public and src/assets directories, image optimization strategies, and branding asset management. Explain the difference between public assets (served directly) and module assets (processed by Vite). Include documentation for logo management, partner institution images, and promotional materials. Provide guidelines for adding new assets, optimizing image sizes, implementing lazy loading, and maintaining asset versioning. Document the asset pipeline, build-time processing, and deployment considerations for media files. Address accessibility requirements for images, alt text implementation, and responsive image strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Site Footer
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the site footer component. Document the Footer component's implementation including copyright information, legal links, and site navigation elements. Explain the footer layout structure, responsive design considerations, and content organization. Detail the integration with the overall site design and branding requirements. Document any social media links, additional navigation, or promotional content placement. Include implementation details for footer customization, content updates, and maintenance procedures. Provide examples of footer modifications and brand-specific customizations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Build and Deployment
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive build and deployment documentation for the Vertex Education website. Document the Vite build configuration, development vs production environments, and optimization strategies. Explain the build process, asset bundling, code splitting, and performance optimizations. Include deployment strategies for various platforms (static hosting, CDN distribution), environment variable management, and build artifact analysis. Document the production build output structure, asset optimization techniques, and caching strategies. Provide deployment checklists, troubleshooting common build issues, and performance monitoring approaches. Address continuous integration workflows, automated deployments, and rollback procedures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Development Guidelines
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive development guidelines for the Vertex Education website project. Document code organization principles, naming conventions, component structure standards, and React best practices. Include ESLint configuration, code formatting standards, commit message conventions, and branch management strategies. Provide guidelines for component development, state management patterns, and performance optimization. Document testing approaches, debugging strategies, and code review processes. Include contribution guidelines, pull request templates, and development workflow recommendations. Address accessibility standards, security considerations, and maintainability practices. Provide examples of well-structured components and common development patterns used throughout the codebase.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>

# Vertex Education - Educational Consultancy Website

## Project Introduction

**Purpose Statement**
Vertex Education is a modern, interactive educational consultancy website designed to provide comprehensive guidance for students pursuing higher education opportunities across India and internationally.

**Core Goals and Objectives**
- Serve as a centralized platform for educational counseling and admission guidance
- Showcase partnerships with premier educational institutions across multiple states
- Provide detailed course offerings and college information
- Deliver an engaging user experience with modern web technologies
- Facilitate easy navigation between different sections of the educational journey

**Target Audience**
- Students seeking admission counseling for medical, engineering, management, and allied health programs
- Parents looking for comprehensive educational guidance
- Prospective international students exploring study abroad opportunities
- Educational consultants and agents requiring professional networking platforms

## Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown

The project follows a modular React-based architecture with clear separation of concerns:

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[App.jsx] --> B[Navbar.jsx]
    A --> C[Hero.jsx]
    A --> D[About.jsx]
    A --> E[Services.jsx]
    A --> F[Courses.jsx]
    A --> G[Partners.jsx]
    A --> H[Colleges.jsx]
    A --> I[Contact.jsx]
    A --> J[Footer.jsx]
    A --> K[CustomCursor.jsx]
    
    H --> L[CollegeListPage.jsx]
    
    M[main.jsx] --> N[BrowserRouter]
    N --> A
```

### Design Patterns

The application implements several key design patterns:

- **Component Composition Pattern**: Modular components that can be composed together
- **Single Responsibility Principle**: Each component handles specific functionality
- **State Management**: React hooks for local component state management
- **Navigation Pattern**: React Router for client-side routing

### System Relationships

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[User Interaction] --> B[React Router]
    B --> C[Component Rendering]
    C --> D[State Updates]
    D --> E[UI Changes]
    
    F[External Dependencies] --> G[React Ecosystem]
    G --> H[Anime.js for Animations]
    G --> I[React Icons]
    G --> J[React Router DOM]
```

## Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points

**Application Bootstrap** (`src/main.jsx`)
- Configures React application with strict mode and router provider
- Sets up global CSS imports
- Initializes the root rendering process

**Core Application** (`src/App.jsx`)
- Defines main routing structure with nested components
- Implements responsive navigation system
- Manages page-level layout and component composition

### Core Modules

**Navigation System** (`src/components/Navbar.jsx`)
- Implements responsive mobile-friendly navigation
- Handles scroll-based styling changes
- Provides smooth scrolling to section anchors
- Manages mobile menu state and transitions

**Interactive Elements** (`src/components/CustomCursor.jsx`)
- Creates custom animated cursor with trailing effect
- Integrates with anime.js library for smooth animations
- Implements hover state detection for interactive elements

**Content Sections** (`src/components/`)
- **Hero Section** (`Hero.jsx`): Dynamic animated hero with call-to-action buttons
- **About Section** (`About.jsx`): Statistics and mission presentation
- **Services Section** (`Services.jsx`): Five-point service grid with icons
- **Courses Section** (`Courses.jsx`): Comprehensive course categories with tags
- **Partners Section** (`Partners.jsx`): Marquee-style institution showcase
- **Colleges Section** (`Colleges.jsx`): Location-based college gateway
- **Contact Section** (`Contact.jsx`): Information display with contact form

### Configuration Approach

**Build Configuration** (`vite.config.js`)
- Vite-based build system with React plugin
- Optimized development and production builds
- Asset optimization and bundling strategies

**Package Management** (`package.json`)
- Modern React 19 with functional components and hooks
- Essential dependencies: React Router DOM, Anime.js, React Icons
- Development tools: ESLint, Vite, React Refresh

### External Dependencies

**Core Dependencies**:
- `react`: ^19.2.0 - Primary UI framework
- `react-dom`: ^19.2.0 - React DOM rendering
- `react-router-dom`: ^7.12.0 - Client-side routing
- `animejs`: ^4.2.2 - Animation library for cursor effects
- `react-icons`: ^5.5.0 - Icon components

**Development Dependencies**:
- `@vitejs/plugin-react`: ^5.1.1 - Vite React plugin
- `eslint`: ^9.39.1 - Code quality and linting
- `vite`: ^7.2.4 - Build tool and development server

### Integration Points

**Asset Management**:
- Static images for logos and location cards
- SVG assets for branding elements
- Responsive image handling for college listings

**State Management Flow**:
```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant U as User
    participant N as Navbar
    participant R as React Router
    participant P as Page Component
    
    U->>N: Click Navigation
    N->>R: Navigate to Section
    R->>P: Render Target Component
    P->>U: Display Content
```

## Key Features

### Functionality Overview

**Multi-State College Directory** (`src/components/Colleges.jsx`, `src/components/CollegeListPage.jsx`)
- Interactive location-based college browsing
- State-specific college listings with placeholder images
- Responsive grid layout for optimal viewing

**Professional Service Showcase** (`src/components/Services.jsx`)
- Five core service categories with professional icons
- Consistent card-based layout with hover effects
- Comprehensive coverage of educational consulting services

**Educational Institution Partnerships** (`src/components/Partners.jsx`)
- Domestic and international partner institution display
- Smooth marquee animations for continuous scrolling
- Professional branding and recognition

### Implementation Highlights

**Responsive Design System** (`src/components/*.css`)
- Mobile-first responsive layouts
- Consistent spacing and typography
- Interactive hover states and transitions

**Performance Optimizations**
- Lazy loading for images and components
- Efficient state management with React hooks
- Minimal re-renders through proper component structure

### Feature Architecture

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> HomePage
    HomePage --> CollegesPage: Select Location
    CollegesPage --> CollegeDetail: Click College
    CollegeDetail --> HomePage: Back Navigation
    
    HomePage --> ServicesSection: Scroll/Click
    HomePage --> AboutSection: Scroll/Click
    HomePage --> ContactForm: Submit Form
    
    ServicesSection --> HomePage: Back Navigation
    AboutSection --> HomePage: Back Navigation
    ContactForm --> HomePage: Submission Complete
```

**Sources:**
- [package.json](package.json)
- [vite.config.js](vite.config.js)
- [main.jsx](src/main.jsx)
- [App.jsx](src/App.jsx)
- [Navbar.jsx](src/components/Navbar.jsx)
- [Hero.jsx](src/components/Hero.jsx)
- [Colleges.jsx](src/components/Colleges.jsx)
- [CollegeListPage.jsx](src/components/CollegeListPage.jsx)
- [CustomCursor.jsx](src/components/CustomCursor.jsx)
- [About.jsx](src/components/About.jsx)
- [Services.jsx](src/components/Services.jsx)
- [Courses.jsx](src/components/Courses.jsx)
- [Partners.jsx](src/components/Partners.jsx)
- [Contact.jsx](src/components/Contact.jsx)

</blog>
